TopicTitle: Recently i got contract to move satellite that i launched earlier into different orbit

Articles.Content:
Unfortunately, I have little time to play my favorite game because I have to write my thesis work.

Recently I had a little more time, he turned on KSP :-)

 

Imagine my surprise when one of your contacts what was disposal concerned parameter changes the orbit of the satellite, which previously I launched into space :-)

 

 

Edited February 4, 2016 by Pawelk198604

Yup, that's new since contextual contracts.  I found out the hard way that they don't always offer an easy contract that way, though-- two of mine simply didn't have enough delta-V remaining to make the required adjustment.  I eyeball 'em closer before accepting the contracts now...

I usually decline these missions as most of my satellites are for ScanSat or RemoteTech and in their current orbits for a reason, however there's something to be said for launching any that are specifically for a "launch a new satellite" mission with enough fuel to make a couple of fairly major course changes in case you get later missions
Yeah, I've gotten a few. I generally ignore them because it's boring, but if I need money I'll do them.

2 hours ago, Choctofliatrio2.0 said:

Yeah, I've gotten a few. I generally ignore them because it's boring, but if I need money I'll do them.

Yes i got some money for it sadly i not get any tech point for it

Edited February 4, 2016 by Pawelk198604
